page.title: 14JANE'S COUNTRY WALK
page.content: Through a field of oil seed rape,along side Brook Cottages.Two ponds,ducks swimming,beagle chasing.Fighting our way through the undergrowth.A wood,a squirrel,unafraid;very dark in the wood,wispy grass swaying in the wind. A stream at the crossroads_Tim sees a fox,a shout,a streak of red and into the undergrowth. Which path to take? Into the gravel pits.Helen's arms full of grasses and wild flowers. All the time the brook beside us. Soon out by a house,into a lane. Walking in single file,carefully, because of the sharp bends.Back to the car,where we had begun.
